Kay,
 
If I overlooked your e-mail. Please forgive me.
I get so many a day=
, some times a couple get lost in the schuffle.
 
I you resend it I wiil be=
 happy to answer any questions you have.
 
bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-=
ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: psfponies@...: Sun, 30 Mar 2008 18:00:31=
 -0700Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP questions_can anyone help ?





The i=
nvitation isn't much good if you don't get back to people who email you!
 
=
Kaybruce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:
Maragaret, T=
he reason I extend an invitation to new people to contact me off group if t=
hey wish,Is for two reasons, the first most new people tend to be shy and r=
eserved and intimidated when it comes to asking public questionsmost feel t=
hat their questions may be viewed as silly or not deserving of serious expl=
ination. I have encountered many instances like this.It just helps them to =
take the first couple of steps if they feel they are in a confidential envi=
ronment. Also, I tend to be very long winded in my responses and answers wi=
th explinations, and I don't think that the more experienced members here t=
hat have heard it all before care to hear a three paragraph post on why you=
 should use the 470 instead of the 469. I am always available on and off bo=
ard to answer any and all questions I am able. Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: =
EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: ITCdeadpeople@...: Sun, 30 Mar 2008 22=
:18:57 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP questions_can anyone help ?


Hi Bru=
ce. Just a thought.... It's really sweet of you to make yourself so availab=
le to people, but if you have members take inquiries of this nature off the=
 boards by having them contact your privately, you are limiting the amount =
of learning that can take place. There are likely "lurkers" here, who will =
never join or come forward, but could really benefit from Lyn's questions a=
nd the answers she receives from the group. Taking communication privately =
also eliminates the possibility for her to receive multiple opinions. (not =
to imply there isn't a time for privacy!) ;0)Like I said, just a thought. M=
argaret--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday <paranormalinvestigat=
ing@...> wrote:>> > Lyn,> > I would be happy to help you and answer any que=
stions you have.> you can e-mail me if you like> > paranormalinvestigating@=
...> > any time> Bruce> Bruce Halliday > > > To: EVP-ITC@...: ITCdeadpeople=
@...: Sun, 30 Mar 2008 20:09:51 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP questions_c=
an anyone help ?> > > > > Hi Lyn. I'm sure several of us here could help yo=
u. What are your questions? Margaret--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Lyn" <=
angels4lyn@> wrote:>> HI> I'm one of the quiet members here. trying to lear=
n from everyone.> I have activity in my home. so I purchased an RCA digital=
 recorder> which is amazing.> I have captured several EVPs, some quite clea=
r, some a bit too fast> so I slow it down to hear it. some are voices , som=
e answer questions, some > are just noises.> > does anyone have experience =
with EVPs on digital recorders ?> I have a ton of questions... and need adv=
ice on some of them.> > thanks> Lyn> angels4lyn@> > > > > > > > ___________=

nswers with Windows Live Messenger.> http://www.windowslive.com/messenger/o=

know your celebrity gossip? Talk celebrity smackdowns here.
